comments.body: You generated a topology with 256 GPUs, but attempted to run a task requiring 4096 GPUs. It's recommended to increase the topology scale.
I fix this problem ,  word_size(gpus)) in workload  change to 256 ,But， still abort: Workload.cc:798 index < SIZE

> I fix this problem , word_size(gpus)) in workload change to 256 ,But， still abort: Workload.cc:798 index < SIZE

I identified the cause of the issue: you didn't use the latest AICB to generate the workload, which resulted in the workload file missing the "pp_comm" field in the first line, causing a parsing error. You can try using the latest AICB repository to generate the workload. Additionally, I will work on optimizing the parsing logic for this part.
OK，thans , use lastest AICB ， This problem can be solved

satisfaction_conditions: Ensure workload file compatibility with the simulation setup
Use updated tools/workflows for workload generation
Validate topology scale matches workload requirements
Provide clear guidance on workload file structure validation

_classification.category: Requires build environment but hard to be dockerized
